terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control
Class RelativeDragger

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.RelativeDragger
public class RelativeDragger
extends java.lang.Object

A convenience class "dragger" with mouse and keyboard input and an InputDragTarget event output whose position is relative to the drag start position in the source display space. If more than one source display is used, the same dragger configuration applies to all of them.

The event chain uses a mouse and keyboard drag sensor; connects the keyboard output to an absolute offset filter driven by the mouse for keyboard input reference; enables the two sensor outputs according to button and modifier conditions; connects each enable output to scale filters; connects those two filters to a drag enable filter used for drag canceling; and connects that filter to an input drag splitter as the event out.

Arrow keys are inherently a relative device. To use them as an absolute device the mouse is used to establish an absolute reference position by means of an input move sensor connected to an input offset filter that filters the arrow sensor output.

Constructor Detail

RelativeDragger

public RelativeDragger()
Constructs an RelativeDragger. For it to work, you must use addEventSource() to add a source display.

RelativeDragger

public RelativeDragger(javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D source,
                       InputDragTarget target)
Constructs an RelativeDragger with an event source and target.

Parameters:
source - Event and space source display. Null if none, but one must eventually be added.
target - Event target. Null if none.

RelativeDragger

public RelativeDragger(javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D source,
                       InputDragTarget target,
                       int mouseButtons,
                       int mouseModifiers,
                       int arrowModifiers,
                       javax.vecmath.Vector2d mouseScale,
                       javax.vecmath.Vector2d arrowScale)
Constructs an RelativeDragger with an event target and common parameters.

Parameters:
source - Event and space source display. Null if none, but one must eventually be added.
target - Event target. Null if none.
mouseButtons - Button flags (Input.BUTTON_???). Defaults to Input.BUTTON_ALL. If BUTTON_NONE or BUTTON_IGNORE, mouse dragging is disabled.
mouseModifiers - Modifier flags (Input.MODIFIER_???). Defaults to MODIFIER_ALL. If MODIFIER_IGNORE, mouse dragging is disabled.
arrowModifiers - Modifier flags (Input.MODIFIER_???). Defaults to MODIFIER_ALL. If MODIFIER_IGNORE, arrow dragging is disabled.
mouseScale - Mouse drag scale factor by input dimension. Defaults to (0.01, 0.01). Null if none.
arrowScale - Arrow drag scale factor by input dimension. Defaults to (0.01, 0.01). Null if none.
Method Detail

getEventOut

public InputDragSplitter getEventOut()
Gets the event output splitter. Use it to add and remove event targets.

Returns:
Reference to the event out splitter. Never null.

addEventSource

public void addEventSource(javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D source)
Adds a 3D display as an event source for this dragger, and sets capability bits of its view platform for use in intuitive mapping.

Parameters:
source - Event and space source display. Never null.

Sets the mouse buttons that enable mouse dragging.

Sets the modifier keys that enable mouse dragging.

Parameters:
modifiers - Modifier flags (Input.MODIFIER_???). Defaults to MODIFIER_ALL. If MODIFIER_IGNORE, mouse dragging is disabled.

Sets the modifier keys that enable arrow dragging.

Parameters:
modifiers - Modifier flags (Input.MODIFIER_???). Defaults to MODIFIER_ALL. If MODIFIER_IGNORE, arrow dragging is disabled.

Sets the mouse drag scaling factor.

Parameters:

Sets the arrow drag scaling factor.

Parameters:
scale - Mouse drag scale factor by input dimension. Defaults to (0.01, 0.01). Null if none.
